item.title: Video: Israeli Missile Hits Lebanon Journalist's Home During Live Interview
item.description: A Lebanese journalist sustained injuries when an Israeli missile struck his home while he was conducting a live TV interview. Fadi Boudaya, the editor-in-chief of Miraya International Network, was seen losing his balance and thrown off-screen.

item.title: "Serious Concern": Japan, New Zealand As China Conducts Rare Missile Test
item.description: China test-launched an intercontinental ballistic missile on Wednesday, firing it into the Pacific Ocean in its first such exercise in decades.

item.title: "Don't Want To Be Sandwiched...": New Lanka President's India-China Plans
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake - Sri Lanka's new Marxist President - has said he wants to avoid being "sandwiched" between India and China but recognises each as a "valued partner", as he tries to resolve a financial crisis roiling his country.

item.title: Deleted tweets, canceled events, erased endorsements: How Republicans are fleeing from Mark Robinson - CNN
item.description:
1. Deleted tweets, canceled events, erased endorsements: How Republicans are fleeing from Mark Robinson  CNN
  2. CNN Poll: Harris and Trump locked in exceedingly close presidential race  CNN
  3. Newly unearthed data shows closer links to Robinson and porn, dating sites  POLITICO
  4. Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee, head of GOP governors, pulls endorsement of Mark Robinson  Tennessean
  5. Mark Robinson Scandal in North Carolina Injects Chaos Into Presidential Race  The Wall Street Journal

item.title: Middle East crisis live: Israel launches further strikes on southern Lebanon after missile fired at Tel Aviv intercepted
item.description:
IDF says it is carrying out more strikes on southern Lebanon and the Bekaa Valley

  • Full report: New Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon as Hezbollah confirms death of senior commander
  • UK nationals in Lebanon: have you been affected by the strikes?

Lebanon’s minister of culture, Judge Mohammad Wissam El-Mortada, has been speaking to Sputnik Radio, and Lebanon’s National News Agency is carrying some quotes from the interview.

In it, he said “Lebanon is engaged in a confrontation in defence of everything that is humane in this world against the enemies of humanity. Israel is exceeding all restrictions.”

Continue reading...

item.title: Long-term sick need to get back to work where they can, says Starmer
item.description:
Labour leader says there should be more support to help people back into jobs, vowing to do ‘everything we can to tackle worklessness’

  • UK politics live – latest updates

People who have been on long-term sickness leave and claiming benefits will need get back into the workplace “where they can”, Keir Starmer has said.

The prime minister said he wants more schemes across the country that support people back into work from long-term sickness because he believes in the “basic proposition that you should look for work”.

Continue reading...

item.title: War comes home to Russia in tranquil lakeside town
Israel has landed heavy blows on Hezbollah. The victory it seeks could prove elusive
Ukraine says its soldiers recaptured a Russian stronghold after hand-to-hand fighting
